benchmark_details.name: TESTAGENT
benchmark_details.overview: TESTAGENT is a framework for automatic benchmarking and exploratory evaluation of large language models (LLMs) in vertical domains, enabling dynamic multi-turn interactions and scalable automated benchmark creation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide an automated and scalable framework for benchmarking and evaluating LLMs in various specialized domains.

data.source: Domain-specific knowledge bases created using retrieval-augmented generation from various sector documents.
data.size: Approximately 30,000 generated questions across multiple domains.
data.annotation: Automated generation based on retrieved knowledge and dynamic interaction.

methodology.calculation: Scores are calculated based on dynamic interactions and multi-turn user feedback.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better model performance in terms of dynamism, accuracy, and stability.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments across various vertical domains were conducted to validate the framework.
